title: Restrict Admin Panel to Single Admin Account and Remove Admin Password Prompt

requirements.text: Restrict Admin Panel visibility so it is not shown to any user unless they are logged in as the admin account identified by the email "yug553496@gmail.com" (Option B: no extra admin password screen).

quotes: Pls remove admin panel from everyone it show only when Login from yug553496@gmail.com mail it and in admin panel no password required

acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as any non-admin user, the UI does not show any Admin Panel entry points (buttons/links/routes/sections).
When logged in as the admin account ("yug553496@gmail.com"), the Admin Panel entry point is visible and navigates directly to the Admin Panel without prompting for an admin password.

requirements.text: Remove the admin password verification flow from the Admin Panel access path so that admin access is granted solely by being authenticated as the admin account; update all user-facing copy to match (no references to entering an admin password).

quotes: in admin panel no password required

acceptanceCriteria: AdminAccessDialog (or any equivalent password prompt) is not required to enter Admin Panel.
There is no hardcoded admin password check remaining in the admin access flow.
All user-facing text is in English and does not instruct the user to enter an admin password to access Admin Panel.

requirements.text: Enforce server-side admin authorization for all admin operations and all admin-only data access, ensuring non-admin callers cannot access admin queries or mutations even if they manipulate the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: All admin-only backend methods trap or reject when called by non-admin principals.
Admin-only data queries (e.g., fetching all user data) remain inaccessible to non-admin users regardless of frontend changes.

requirements.text: Ensure Admin Panel supports these admin actions for individual users: activate a subscription plan for a specific user; add/manage payment methods/payment options; create/manage discount options; and kick out a specific user.

quotes: that activate subscription plan  for individual person only done by admin and for admin also give add payment methods or payment options and discounts option and kick out any person

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can select a specific user and activate a subscription plan for that user only (does not affect other users).
Admin can add/update/remove payment methods/payment options visible in the app where applicable.
Admin can create/update/remove discount options and apply them where applicable.

Admin can trigger a 'kick out' action for a specific user, and the kicked user is forced out of the app session on their next interaction (e.g., they see an access/session-ended state and must log in again).
All these actions are rejected by the backend for non-admin callers.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose instead).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook entrypoints listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose alternatives if needed).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; create backend/migration.mo updates only if state schema changes require it.
nonGoals: Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Implementing external database storage beyond canister state.
